alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 20 at 5:52PM PDT until August 21 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of north central, northeast, and northwest Nevada, including the following areas, in north central Nevada, Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County. In northeast Nevada, Northern Elko County, South Central Elko County, Southeastern Elko County and Southwest Elko County. In northwest Nevada, Humboldt County. * WHEN...Through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage, urban areas, and highways. Low-water crossings may be flooded from rising floodwater. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Extensive tropical moisture from Tropical Cyclone Hilary has begun impacting the area. Expect the moisture to advance northward bringing additional showers and thunderstorms to the entire region tonight and Monday. Northern and northeast Nevada is forecast to receive precipitation totals through 5 am PDT Tuesday with 1 to 3 inches rainfall amounts and isolated amounts up to 4 inches possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
